references.paper_title: Scaling laws for language encoding models in fMRI
references.reason: This paper introduces a scaling law for language encoding models applied to fMRI, a key finding that this study replicates and extends.

references.paper_title: Natural speech reveals the semantic maps that tile human cerebral cortex
references.reason: This highly influential paper established the use of fMRI and language models to understand brain activity, providing a foundation for this work.

references.paper_title: Disentangling syntax and semantics in the brain with deep networks
references.reason: This study uses deep learning models to investigate the neural correlates of language, a relevant comparison to the approach in this paper.

references.paper_title: Interpreting and improving natural-language processing (in machines) with natural-language-processing (in the brain)
references.reason: This paper is pivotal in connecting computational models of language with brain activity, directly inspiring many aspects of the present research.

references.paper_title: Scaling laws for neural language models
references.reason: This work presents scaling laws for neural language models that are relevant to understanding the performance differences observed in the present research across models of varying sizes.
